abstract.p: Article discusses upcoming college football game between Pittsburgh and Syracuse (M)

block.p: Today's KEY GAMES

NO. 1 FLORIDA STATE 5-0 NO. 7 at MIAMI 3-1 Florida State, the new No. 1 in the Associated Press news media poll, is averaging 50 points a game. Last Saturday, the Seminoles gained 613 yards in a 59-7 victory over Maryland, prompting Terrapins Coach Ron Vanderlinden to call his conqueror ''the most talented football team in the country.'' But Chris Weinke, Florida State's quarterback, has a sprained left foot, and Miami's good defense is getting better.TV: CH2, Noon

NO. 10 OKLAHOMA 4-0 NO. 11 vs. texas (at Dallas)3-1 This traditional battle looks like a tossup. Texas quarterback Major Applewhite has passed for nine touchdowns and Oklahoma's Josh Heupel has eight this season. Last week, Heupel passed for 346 yards against Kansas, which had been leading the nation in pass defense (84 yards a game).
Today's KEY GAMES

NO. 1 FLORIDA STATE 5-0 NO. 7 at MIAMI 3-1 Florida State, the new No. 1 in the Associated Press news media poll, is averaging 50 points a game. Last Saturday, the Seminoles gained 613 yards in a 59-7 victory over Maryland, prompting Terrapins Coach Ron Vanderlinden to call his conqueror ''the most talented football team in the country.'' But Chris Weinke, Florida State's quarterback, has a sprained left foot, and Miami's good defense is getting better.TV: CH2, Noon

NO. 10 OKLAHOMA 4-0 NO. 11 vs. texas (at Dallas)3-1 This traditional battle looks like a tossup. Texas quarterback Major Applewhite has passed for nine touchdowns and Oklahoma's Josh Heupel has eight this season. Last week, Heupel passed for 346 yards against Kansas, which had been leading the nation in pass defense (84 yards a game).

NO. 6 MICHIGAN 4-1 at PURDUE 3-2 An even struggle between two of the Big Ten's endless store of present or past Top 25 teams. After a broken foot, Drew Henson is back full time as Michigan's quarterback. As long as Purdue has Drew Brees's passing, it may beat almost anyone.TV: CH7, Noon
OTHER GAMES
EAST
Pittsburgh (4-0) at Syracuse (2-2) Syracuse seems to have awakened just in time for its Big East season. TV: ESPN2, 4:30 p.m.
Yale (2-1) at Dartmouth (0-3) Yale can pass, and Dartmouth can't stop the pass.
Princeton (1-2) at Colgate (3-1) Colgate beat Towson last week when cornerback Brandon Tinson blocked three punts, leading to three touchdowns.
Lafayette (1-3) at Columbia (1-2) Columbia, with a big offense, folded at the end against Princeton.
SOUTH

No. 15 Auburn (5-0) at No. 20 Mississippi State (3-1) While Mississippi State was upsetting Florida with 517 yards in total offense (351 rushing), Auburn was holding Vanderbilt to 152 yards. TV: CH2, 3:30 p.m.
Louisiana State (3-2) at No. 12 Florida (4-1) Florida quarterback Jesse Palmer has a sprained ankle; the ground game is feeble, and the defense is in disarray.
No. 21 Tennessee (2-2) at No. 19 Georgia (3-1) Despite Tennessee's ragged start, Coach Phillip Fulmer insists, ''We're still definitely in the hunt.'' TV: ESPN, 7 p.m.
North Carolina State (4-0) at No. 5 Clemson (5-0) Clemson Quarterback Woodrow Dantzler has rolled up at last 300 yards in total offense on each of the last three Saturdays.
MIDWEST
No. 8 Ohio State (4-0) at No. 24 Wisconsin (3-2) Ohio State is off to a 4-0 start for the seventh time in 10 years. TV: CH7, 3:30 p.m.
Stanford (2-2) at No. 25 Notre Dame (2-2) Matt LoVecchio, a freshman, will probably start at quarterback for Notre Dame. TV: CH4, 2:30 p.m.
No. 2 Nebraska (4-0) at Iowa State (4-0) Iowa State is off to its best start in 20 years, but its solid running and pass protection aren't enough here.
No. 4 Kansas State (5-0) at Kansas (2-2) Kansas, slowed by six turnovers and six sacks, took a beating from Oklahoma. This should be more of the same.
Penn State (2-4) at Minnesota (3-2) Was Penn State's upset of Purdue the start of something good for the Nittany Lions? This game might tell. TV: ESPN2, Noon
Indiana (2-2) at No. 22 Northwestern (4-1) On the last two Saturdays, Northwestern has upset Wisconsin and Michigan State while averaging 525 yards in total offense.
FAR WEST
No. 23 Oregon State (4-0) at No. 13 Washington (3-1) Oregon State is 4-0 for the first time since 1957, and linebacker Nick Barnett warned, ''We're not done yet.'' TV: FSNY, 10:15 p.m.
Arizona (3-1) at No. 18 Southern Cal (3-1) Southern California couldn't stop Oregon State's running game, and Arizona has uncovered a good freshman runner in Clarence Farmer.
Army (0-4) at New Mexico State (0-4) Army is still having problems with its new passing offense.
MISMATCHES
Temple (3-2) at No. 3 Virginia Tech (4-0) Virginia Tech rushed for 420 yards in beating Boston College.
Hawaii (0-3) at No. 14 Texas Christian (4-0) T.C.U.'s LaDainian Tomlinson averages 170 yards a game rushing.
Connecticut (2-3) at Boston College (2-2) UConn's first season in Division I-A has been trying.
South Florida (3-2) at No. 17 So. Mississippi (3-1) Southern Mississippi hasn't allowed a touchdown in 13 quarters.
COLLEGE FOOTBALL
